thread.title: Oscar-Nominated Actor Mahershala Ali Welcomes His First Child, and It's a Girl!
thread.title_full: Oscar-Nominated Actor Mahershala Ali Welcomes His First Child, and It's a Girl!

author: maressabrown
title: Oscar-Nominated Actor Mahershala Ali Welcomes His First Child, and It's a Girl!
text:
Oscar-Nominated Actor Mahershala Ali Welcomes His First Child, and It's a Girl! Oscar-Nominated Actor Mahershala Ali Welcomes His First Child, and It's a Girl! 
The Moonlight star's wife Amatus Sami-Karim gave birth to a daughter on February 22. By Maressa Brown Comments 
Paul Archuleta/Getty Images Moonlight star Mahershala Ali, may be crossing his fingers to win the Oscar for Best Supporting Actor at the 89th Annual Academy Awards this weekend, but he already has so much to celebrate! Ali and his wife Amatus Sami-Karim welcomed their first child earlier this week, reports People . The actor announced the birth of his daughter on Instagram with an intimate, black and white photo. In the caption, Ali also shared his little girl's pretty name. 
"Bari (Bar-ee) Najma Ali ðŸ’œ2/22/17 #pisces ," Ali wrote. A post shared by Mahershala Ali (@mahershalaali) on Feb 24, 2017 at 12:22pm PST RELATED: Check Out the Best-Dressed Bumps on the Oscars Red Carpet 
Ali appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live ! back in January and joked with the late night host about his first L.O. being due during Oscar season. "I'm hosting the show, and you do what you wanna do, but it'd be really great for our ratings if your wife had the baby during the Oscars," Kimmel joked. "During the monologue would be ideal." To that, Ali replied, "That'd be good â€” nice private and public!" 
It was back in December that Ali and his wife first shared that they were expecting. One month later, he took home a SAG Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role! (His baby girl must be his lucky charm!) At the show, he talked to E! News about his impending fatherhood, noting that he was "looking forward to having a new teacher. Kids teach. They're the truth. I'm ready to learn my lessons and learn them well, and I hope I have something to teach our child." So lovely. New parent? Sign up for our Parents Daily Babies newsletter 
Congratulations to this beautiful family of three â€” and best of luck to the proud new papa on Oscars night!
